result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Curt Royce

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial conference set for September 19th - not deliverable as addressed - unable to forward - return to sender.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Exhibit P#1 - Copy of the criminal complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:00 PM Defendant Jeffrey Curt Royce in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jeffrey Curt Royce. Cases 22CF295 Preliminary and 22CT71-Status.
ADA Cassidy calls witness Officer Denault who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Exhibit P#1 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
ADA Cassidy moves exhibit P#1. No objections.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit P#1 is received.
No further questions.
Final arguments are heard.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from the DA's Office on behalf of C.C. in re:  request to have contact with the defendant (defendant is represented by counsel and will need to a motion to modify bond)

2:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey Curt Royce appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jeffrey Curt Royce. 

Atty McFarland received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty McFarland was not aware that the defendant was in custody and has not had a chance to meet with the defendant. 
Court questions the defendant regarding his in custody status. 
Defendant responds.  He is on a probation hold. He has not received a copy of the complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty McFarland notes there is an active warrant in 22CT71.  Asks to complete the initial appearance at this time. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Matter to be set for status conference.
Atty Dodge requests a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty McFarland does not object.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for July 5, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with the Victim. Victim can file a waiver of contact with District Attorney office.

1:11 PM Defendant Jeffrey Royce appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC and Bail Jumping. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
